arm_group.description: transvaginal resection of Uterine Scar From Previous Cesarean Delivery

brief_summary.textblock:
The aim of this study is to further demonstrate the safety , validity and quality of
      (sexual)life  of vaginal operation for previous cesarean scar defect resection.

clinical_study.brief_title: Quality of Life and Sexual Function of Vaginal Operation in The Treatment Of Previous Cesarean Scar Defect

detailed_description.textblock:
collect all the patients'clinical information,use two questionnaire (the HRQoL and FSFI)to
      estimate patients' general healthy and sexual function before surgery and postoperation in 1
      month,3 months and 6 months

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  preoperative diagnosed as PCSD

          -  hemodynamic stability

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  irregular menstrual cycle

          -  using IUD

          -  complicating other disease also causing vaginal bleeding,such as endometrial
             polyp,submucous myoma and  functional uterine bleeding.

study_pop.textblock:
60 patients diagnosed PCSD scheduled for vaginal operation in The First Affiliated
        Hospital between December 2013 and  December 2015

intervention.description: Expose, grasp and traction the cervix. An incision was made at the anterior cervicovaginal junction, and the bladder was dissected away until the anterior peritoneal reflection was identified. The anterior drawing hook was inserted.into the vaginal incision to retract the bladder upwards. The PCSD was identified as a'fornix' located in the anterior part of the lower uterine segment. A transverse incision was made to remove the scar deficiency, and the edges of the incision were trimmed with scissors, and the myometrial and vaginal defects were closed.

keyword: Uterine Scar From Previous Cesarean Delivery

facility.name: The First Affiliated Hospital of Sun Yat-sen University

clinical_study.official_title: Safety ,Validity and Quality of (Sexual)Life of Vaginal Operation in The Treatment Of Previous Cesarean Scar Defect

other_outcome.measure: the result of transvaginal resection of caesarean scar deficiency in affecting quality of (sex)life.

overall_official.affiliation: First Affiliated Hospital, Sun Yat-Sen University
First Affiliated Hospital, Sun Yat-Sen University
First Affiliated Hospital, Sun Yat-Sen University

primary_outcome.description: blood loss, hemoglobin in the first postoperative day, operation time, preoperative and postoperative complications,change to other treatment,vaginal bleeding after surgery and length of stay are collected to evaluate the safety of this procedure.
primary_outcome.measure: The safety of transvaginal resection of caesarean scar deficiency in the treatment of PCSD

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: First Affiliated Hospital, Sun Yat-Sen University
responsible_party.investigator_title: associate professor of gynaecology and obstetricsf

secondary_outcome.description: Observation of menstruation in three months,six months and nine months after surgery is applied for evaluating the effectiveness of this procedure and transvaginal ultrasound,hysteroscopy and Gynecological Examination are performed after surgery.Situation of fertility ,(sex)quality of life after surgery also are very important indicator of this procedure effectiveness
secondary_outcome.measure: the effectiveness of transvaginal resection of caesarean scar deficiency in the treatment of PCSD.

clinical_study.source: First Affiliated Hospital, Sun Yat-Sen University
clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case-Only, Time Perspective: Prospective
